intro: Voyria grandiflora, commonly known as the grandiflora voyria, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a distinctive yellow center. It thrives in high-altitude environments and requires well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
